title: Reverts "[Impeller] Disable Vulkan on Emulators. (#162454)"
body:
<!-- start_original_pr_link -->
Reverts: flutter/flutter#162454
<!-- end_original_pr_link -->
<!-- start_initiating_author -->
Initiated by: jonahwilliams
<!-- end_initiating_author -->
<!-- start_revert_reason -->
Reason for reverting: some CI tests are not opted into vulkan explicitly.
<!-- end_revert_reason -->
<!-- start_original_pr_author -->
Original PR Author: jonahwilliams
<!-- end_original_pr_author -->

<!-- start_reviewers -->
Reviewed By: {matanlurey}
<!-- end_reviewers -->

<!-- start_revert_body -->
This change reverts the following previous change:
Forces known android emulators to use OpenGLES. This is a very conservative check that could be expanded over time if need be. For testing emulators can still use the debug flags.

Fixes https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/160442
Fixes https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/160439
Fixes https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/155973
<!-- end_revert_body -->

title: [in_app_purchase_storekit] Host platform returned null value for non-null return value.
body:
### Steps to reproduce

1.Every time I enter my payment screen I start this code and it gives an error
```dart
final iapConnection = IAPConnectionService.instance;

final available = await iapConnection.isAvailable();
if (!available) {
  return;
}

var appleCountryCode = await iapConnection.countryCode();
```
2.The error that appears on my console:

```
[log] [BILLING] Error: PlatformException(null-error, Host platform returned null value for non-null return value., null, null)
[log] Error: PlatformException(null-error, Host platform returned null value for non-null return value., null, null)
[log] #0      InAppPurchaseAPI.storefront (package:in_app_purchase_storekit/src/messages.g.dart:685:7)
      <asynchronous suspension>

sk_payment_queue_wrapper.dart:57

in_app_purchase_storekit_platform.dart:244

      #3      BillingBloc._getBillingPlans (package:rediredi/src/features/billing/presentation/bloc/billing_bloc.dart:190:36)
billing_bloc.dart:190
      <asynchronous suspension>
      #4      Bloc.on.<anonymous closure>.handleEvent (package:bloc/src/bloc.dart:229:13)
bloc.dart:229
      <asynchronous suspension>
```

pubspec.yml

```yml
dependencies:
  in_app_purchase: ^3.2.1
  in_app_purchase_storekit: ^0.3.21
dependency_overrides:
  in_app_purchase_storekit: ^0.3.21

```


### Expected results

Receive any countryCode about Apple Store

### Actual results

Error

### Code sample

<details open><summary>Code sample</summary>

```dart

  return;
}

title: Connection time out error on specific Mobile Networks
body:
I am getting a strange issue which I am unable to figure out. A few of app users are complaining that app is not working. When I dig into details, I found that it was connection time out error on mobile network of specific telecom. That too happen when user get connected to 5G but more strange part is, it happens on my flutter app only and other app works fine. Now if user get back to 4g, the app works fine on other telecom network provider 5g network app works fine but there is problem with one network ( JIO 5g in India) and after 2-3 efforts of closing app and running it again make it work again. 

I tried to debug app on same network and getting connection time out error in 5g mode. I tried with both packages http and Dio but nothing changed in result

Though reattempts can be created but I want to find the answer why it happens and how it can be resolved.  Any input or help is highly appreciated.

title: Add tests to confirm CupertinoSliverNavigationBar snaps when partially scrolled in .always bottom mode
body: Forgot to add these in https://github.com/flutter/flutter/pull/156381. Spotted it when debugging https://github.com/flutter/flutter/pull/159120.
author: victorsanni

title: [Impeller] Avoid NaN values when setting up for the fast squircle blur shader
body:
Fixes https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/162128

Zero dimensioned rectangle blurs were causing the setup code to generate NaN values. This condition could also happen for some very thin or short rectangles so rather than just rule out zero-dimensioned rectangles, the uniforms are checked for NaN values and the operation is skipped in those cases.

title: [web] Correctly read the repetitionCount for images
body:
There was a bug in `ResizingCodec` where it returned `frameCount` instead of `repetitionCount` in the `repetitionCount` getter, causing animated images to stop animating even if they were set to loop infinitely.

Fixes https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/161800

title: Infinite loop when downloading the SDK
body:
Some (all?) windows bots got stuck into an infinite loop trying to download the Dart SDK.

Examples:
- https://logs.chromium.org/logs/flutter/buildbucket/cr-buildbucket/8724395172445781505/+/u/flutter_config_--clear-features/stdout
- https://logs.chromium.org/logs/flutter/buildbucket/cr-buildbucket/8724395172445781489/+/u/flutter_config_--clear-features/stdout

The scripts need to be fixed such that they have a maximum number of retries.

cc @christopherfujino

title: [Android] SurfaceTransaction updates for HC++.
body: Adds but does not use the ability to use imported Java SurfaceTransactions in the AHB swapchain. When an imported SurfaceTransaction is used, the Swapchain will not apply the transaction and instead will rely on the PlatformViewController to do so.

title: Switching from a release to the master branch results in the wrong dart SDK being downloaded
body: I think this is because we have checked in //flutter/bin/internal/engine.version files on release branches, but it's gitignored on the master branch, but we check for its existence to see if we're on a release branch, but we never delete it when switching from a release to master.
author: christopherfujino

title: Add 2 retries for hybrid composition platform views.
body:
Trying to figure out if flake reports https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/162362 and https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/162363 are related to https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/162310.

I was unable to reproduce locally:

```sh
dart tool/deflake.dart lib/platform_view/hybrid_composition_platform_view_main.dart
```

... so either the Mac Android emulators don't show this behavior, or perhaps its just the slowness of CI VMs.

Either way, this should try taking a screenshot 2 more times (which has built-in waits/sleeps), so if the problem persists that means there is a more critical HC problem (the screen is _always_ drawn black sometimes) versus a more transient problem (it "takes longer").

body:

<!-- end_original_pr_link -->
<!-- start_initiating_author -->
Initiated by: gaaclarke
<!-- end_initiating_author -->

<!-- end_revert_reason -->
<!-- start_original_pr_author -->
Original PR Author: gaaclarke
<!-- end_original_pr_author -->

<!-- start_reviewers -->
Reviewed By: {jonahwilliams}
<!-- end_reviewers -->

<!-- start_revert_body -->
This change reverts the following previous change:
issue: https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/149652
doc: (currently google only) https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Rulw_noQi0G8Glb47vk17uBbb6sySDxlQe-l-0kHn14/edit?tab=t.0

This increases the RMSE value in the test in https://github.com/flutter/flutter/pull/161445 by a slight amount.  I do believe this reduces the time where we get non uniform scalars and protects the integrity of relative spacing, thus being more what we expect.  There is still a bug that has to do with pixel alignment that does give the illusion of stretching and shrinking though because of hard/soft lines.

title: Reverts "Fix `Tab` linear and elastic animation blink (#162315)"
body:
Reverts: flutter/flutter#162315 Initiated by: TahaTesser Reason for reverting: Red tree due to unapproved golden images. Original PR Author: TahaTesser Reviewed By: {justinmc} This change reverts the following previous change: Fixes [https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/162098](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/162098) ### Description This PR fixes `Tab` linear and elastic animation blinks/flickers when skipping multiple tabs. Previous attempt to fix elastic animation didn't cover linear animation tests and didn't have enough number of tab items which this PR fixes. - Fixed Linear and elastic animation blink issue. - Added tests for linear and elastic animation with various tab sizes (LTR and RTL) - Added tests for linear and elastic animation when skipping tabs (LTR and RTL) ### Code Sample

title: SharedPreferencesOptions not available in SharedPreferences package
body:
### Steps to reproduce

Following the Migrating from SharedPreferences to SharedPreferencesAsync/WithCache code on the pub.dev page (https://pub.dev/packages/shared_preferences#migration-and-prefixes). The class SharedPreferencesOptions is unable to be found in the shared_preferences package. It needs to be imported from 'package:shared_preferences_platform_interface/types.dart' which however gives a warning: The imported package 'shared_preferences_platform_interface' isn't a dependency of the importing package. (Documentation).

### Expected results

The SharedPreferencesOptions class can be imported, and the migrateLegacySharedPreferencesToSharedPreferencesAsyncIfNecessary function can be ran. 

### Actual results

If the class is not imported, a  Error: 'SharedPreferencesOptions' isn't a type. error prevents the app from building. If the class is imported, it runs fine however importing from shared_preferences_platform_interface shows a warning

### Code sample

<details open><summary>Code sample</summary>

```dart
import 'package:flutter/material.dart';
import 'package:shared_preferences/shared_preferences.dart';
import 'package:shared_preferences/util/legacy_to_async_migration_util.dart';
//SharedPreferencesOptions Import
import 'package:shared_preferences_platform_interface/types.dart';

void main() async {
  SharedPreferencesOptions sharedPreferencesOptions =
      SharedPreferencesOptions();
  final SharedPreferences prefs = await SharedPreferences.getInstance();
  await migrateLegacySharedPreferencesToSharedPreferencesAsyncIfNecessary(
    legacySharedPreferencesInstance: prefs,
    sharedPreferencesAsyncOptions: sharedPreferencesOptions,
    migrationCompletedKey: 'migrationCompleted',
  );
  runApp(const MyApp());
}

class MyApp extends StatelessWidget {
  const MyApp({super.key});

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return MaterialApp(
        title: 'Flutter Demo',
        theme: ThemeData(
          colorScheme: ColorScheme.fromSeed(seedColor: Colors.deepPurple),
          useMaterial3: true,
        ),
        home: Placeholder());
  }
}






Pubspec: 


dependencies:
  flutter:
    sdk: flutter
  shared_preferences: ^2.4.0

```

</details>


### Screenshots or Video

<details open>

{
  "name": "Windows build_android_host_app_with_module_aar"
}
-->

The post-submit test builder `Windows build_android_host_app_with_module_aar` had a flaky ratio 2.04% for the past (up to) 100 commits, which is above our 2.00% threshold.

One recent flaky example for a same commit: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/flutter/builders/prod/Windows%20build_android_host_app_with_module_aar/1062

title: Text cut off on Android with Impeller
body:
### Steps to reproduce

Tested on a Pixel 6a API 34 emulator.
I also test with Impeller on and off on iOS simulator but no problems there.

### Expected results

Text should be rendered correctly

### Actual results

Text cut off

### Code sample

<details open><summary>Code sample</summary>

```dart
import 'package:flutter/material.dart';

void main() {
  runApp(const MainApp());
}

class MainApp extends StatelessWidget {
  const MainApp({super.key});

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return const MaterialApp(
      home: HomeScreen(),
    );
  }
}

class HomeScreen extends StatelessWidget {
  const HomeScreen({
    super.key,
  });

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Scaffold(
      body: SafeArea(
        child: SingleChildScrollView(
          child: Column(
            children: [
              for (int i = 0; i < 100; i++)
                ListTile(
                  title: Text('Title $i'),
                  subtitle: Text('Subtitle $i'),
                ),
            ],
          ),
        ),
      ),
    );
  }
}

```

title: remove more (simple) usage of package:usage
body:
Towards https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/150575.

Tries to remove as much `Usage` as possible while avoiding more complicated bits that require more scrutiny to make sure we aren't losing test coverage or otherwise regressing. Said another way, almost the entire diff is just deleting code to send GA3 events, and the corresponding GA4 code can be found right next to it—making it easy to verify we aren't losing events/tests.

title: iOS: Token refresh issue with Firebase services after 1 hour
body:
## Description
When using Flutter with Firebase on iOS, all Firebase services become unavailable after approximately 1 hour of usage. This might be related to how Flutter handles platform channel communication for token refresh or background tasks on iOS.

## Related Issues
- FirebaseExtended/flutterfire#11087
- FirebaseExtended/flutterfire#9989
- firebase/firebase-ios-sdk#14389

## Environment
- Flutter version: 3.27.3
- Dart SDK: >=3.6.0 <4.0.0
- Platform: iOS
- Firebase packages:
  - firebase_core: ^3.10.1
  - firebase_auth: ^5.4.1
  - cloud_firestore: ^5.6.2
  - cloud_functions: ^5.3.1
  - firebase_analytics: ^11.4.1
  - firebase_crashlytics: ^4.3.1
  - firebase_messaging: ^15.2.1

## Issue Details
The problem manifests as follows:
1. All Firebase services work correctly for the first hour after login
2. After approximately 1 hour, all Firebase services stop working
3. Various PlatformException errors are thrown
4. The app requires a force quit and relaunch to restore functionality

## Questions
1. Could this be related to how Flutter handles platform channels for background tasks?
2. Are there any known issues with long-running platform channel connections on iOS?
3. Are there specific configurations needed for proper background task handling with Firebase on iOS?

## Error Messages
```
PlatformException(unavailable, The service is currently unavailable...)
PlatformException(unknown, Unknown error or an error from a different error domain...)
PlatformException(internal-error, An internal error has occurred...)
```

title: Reverts "[ Widget Previews ] Add support for detecting previews and generating code (#161911)"
body:
<!-- start_original_pr_link -->
Reverts: flutter/flutter#161911
<!-- end_original_pr_link -->
<!-- start_initiating_author -->
Initiated by: matanlurey
<!-- end_initiating_author -->
<!-- start_revert_reason -->
Reason for reverting: Mid-air collision with another Flutter tool update.
<!-- end_revert_reason -->
<!-- start_original_pr_author -->
Original PR Author: bkonyi
<!-- end_original_pr_author -->

<!-- start_reviewers -->
Reviewed By: {andrewkolos}
<!-- end_reviewers -->

<!-- start_revert_body -->
This change reverts the following previous change:
`flutter widget-preview start` will now look for functions annotated with `@Preview()` within the developer's project. These functions will be used to generate
`.dart_tool/widget_preview_scaffold/lib/generated_preview.dart`, which inserts the returned value from each preview function into a `List<WidgetPreview>` returned from a `previews()` method that is invoked by the widget preview scaffold root.

**Example generated_preview.dart:**

```dart
// ignore_for_file: no_leading_underscores_for_library_prefixes
import 'package:foo/foo.dart' as _i1;
import 'package:foo/src/bar.dart' as _i2;
import 'package:widget_preview/widget_preview.dart';

List<WidgetPreview> previews() => [_i1.preview(), _i2.barPreview1(), _i2.barPreview2()];
```
<!-- end_revert_body -->

title: [flutter_markdown] Longer listBullet content get overflowed
body:
### Steps to reproduce When some styles involving list bullet width are assigned smaller value than their content, list bullet content get overflowed ### Expected results List bullet contents doesn't get overflowed. ### Actual results Being overflowed. Please see screen shot section. I guess list bullet's container isn't assigned only `listIndent` and `listBulletPadding` but it also needs `listBullet`'s width. https://github.com/flutter/packages/blob/02c6fef4ef639ac0467c51bae558c00242d53feb/packages/flutter_markdown/lib/src/builder.dart#L441 ### Code sample
Code sample ```dart import 'package:flutter/material.dart'; import 'package:flutter_markdown/flutter_markdown.dart'; void main() { runApp(const MyApp()); } class MarkdownRenderer extends StatelessWidget { @override Widget build(BuildContext context) { return Container( padding: const EdgeInsets.all(16), child: MarkdownBody( data: ''' ## numbered list 1. list item 1. list item 1. list item 1. list item 1. list item 1. list item 1. list item 1. list item 1. list item 1. list item 1. list item 1. list item ''', styleSheet: MarkdownStyleSheet( listIndent: 14, // default value = 24px listBulletPadding: const EdgeInsets.only(right: 16), ), ), ); } } class MyApp extends StatelessWidget { const MyApp({super.key}); @override Widget build(BuildContext context) { return MaterialApp( home: Scaffold( appBar: AppBar( title: const Text('markdown test'), ), body: MarkdownRenderer(), ), ); } } ```

Screenshots / Video demonstration

author: bkonyi

title: New "Best Practices" Project Template as Skeleton Alternative
body:
### Use case

When creating a new Flutter project, developers (especially newcomers) lack a starter template that demonstrates widely accepted best practices. The removal of the skeleton template has left a gap where projects default to the overly simplistic counter app, which doesn’t guide users on critical topics like internationalization, scalable architecture, routing, or testing. This forces developers to manually research and integrate these practices, leading to inconsistent setups, duplicated effort, and potential technical debt.

**Current Limitations**  
- The default `counter` template focuses on basic functionality, not real-world app structure.
- Newcomers often reinvent the wheel or adopt outdated patterns due to lack of official guidance.
- Teams spend time rebuilding boilerplate for routing, state management, and localization instead of focusing on features.


### Proposal

Introduce a new **official project template** (e.g., `flutter create --template best_practices`) that serves as a foundation for production-ready apps. This template would:

1. **Demonstrate Best Practices**
   - **Clean Architecture**: Separate layers (presentation, domain, data).
   - **State Management**: Provider/Riverpod/Bloc setup with example.
   - **Routing**: GoRouter/Navigator 2.0 with named routes and deep linking.
   - **Internationalization**: Localization with ARB files.
   - **Theming**: Light/dark mode, custom design system.
   - **Testing**: Unit, widget, and integration test examples.

2. **Target Audience**
   - **Newcomers**: Quick starting point to learn best practices.
   - **Experienced Devs**: Save time of boilerplate setup.

3. **Minimal but Opinionated**
   - Avoid overcomplication; focus on a structure that scales.
   - Use [flutter.dev](https://flutter.dev) recommended packages where possible (e.g., `go_router` for navigation).

**Why Flutter Should Provide This**
- **Ecosystem Health**: Reduces fragmentation by promoting consistent patterns.
- **Onboarding**: Lowers the barrier to entry for new Flutter developers.
- **Adoption**: A "batteries included" template makes Flutter more appealing for enterprise/production use.

**Example Structure**
```dart
lib/
├─ core/
│  ├─ routes/         # Routing setup
│  ├─ themes/         # App-wide theming
│  ├─ localization/   # Generated localization classes
├─ features/
│  ├─ home/           # Feature module with presentation/domain/data
├─ main.dart          # Initialization (router, theme, providers)
test/                 # Example tests

author: insane-alt

title: Expose build name and build number as constants
body:
### Use case

Currently, to get the build number and build name of our app, we have to use a separate package (`package_info_plus`). Since build name and build number are known at build time, it would be beneficial to get those values and expose them at the framework level to increase the developer experience and reduce the number of dependencies. 

It’s possible to achieve this behaviour by declaring constants using `—-dart-define` and consuming them with `.fromEnvironment`, but this proposal suggests a more universal (and CI-independent) approach.

### Proposal

Get build name and build number without any third-party dependencies, e.g.:
- `print(FlutterMeta.buildName)`
- `print(FlutterMeta.buildNumber)`

title: Cocoon no longer allows flutter/packages to `autosubmit` fixes for tree breakage
body:
### Type of Request

bug

### Infrastructure Environment

Cocoon

### What is happening?

https://github.com/flutter/cocoon/pull/4176 replaced the `warning: land on red to fix tree breakage` label system with a new `emergency` label. The former worked in flutter/packages, and we used it to land fixes when the tree was broken, per the preferred Flutter policy of not manually landing PRs. The latter, apparently, does not. See https://github.com/flutter/packages/pull/8512 where after I renamed the old label to `emergency` we just get

```
autosubmit label was removed for flutter/packages/8512, because emergency label processing failed
```

with no details about why processing failed. I'm assuming there's some repo-specific logic. Maybe it's looking for the merge queue gate, and since we don't currently have a merge queue in flutter/packages it fails?

/cc @yjbanov

### Steps to reproduce

Step 1: Have a broken flutter/packages tree
Step 2: Post a fix
Step 3: Add `autosubmit` and `emergency`


### Expected results

I expect the PR to autosubmit.

title: Fix `flutter doctor` instructions displayed when `cmdline-tools` (Android SDK) cannot be found
body:
Fixes https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/161457.

`flutter doctor` tells the user to install missing Android command line tools by invoking the command line tools (which are missing). Instead, let's tell the users they can install them from the website (or—more simply—download Android Studio).

title: Bump the all-github-actions group with 2 updates
body:
Bumps the all-github-actions group with 2 updates: [actions/checkout](https://github.com/actions/checkout) and [codecov/codecov-action](https://github.com/codecov/codecov-action). Updates `actions/checkout` from 3 to 4
Release notes

Sourced from actions/checkout's releases.

v4.0.0

What's Changed

  • Update default runtime to node20 by @​takost in actions/checkout#1436
  • Support fetching without the --progress option by @​simonbaird in actions/checkout#1067
  • Release 4.0.0 by @​takost in actions/checkout#1447

New Contributors

  • @​takost made their first contribution in actions/checkout#1436
  • @​simonbaird made their first contribution in actions/checkout#1067

Full Changelog: https://github.com/actions/checkout/compare/v3...v4.0.0

v3.6.0

What's Changed

  • Mark test scripts with Bash'isms to be run via Bash by @​dscho in actions/checkout#1377
  • Add option to fetch tags even if fetch-depth > 0 by @​RobertWieczoreck in actions/checkout#579
  • Release 3.6.0 by @​luketomlinson in actions/checkout#1437

New Contributors

  • @​RobertWieczoreck made their first contribution in actions/checkout#579
  • @​luketomlinson made their first contribution in actions/checkout#1437

Full Changelog: https://github.com/actions/checkout/compare/v3.5.3...v3.6.0

v3.5.3

What's Changed

  • Fix: Checkout Issue in self hosted runner due to faulty submodule check-ins by @​megamanics in actions/checkout#1196
  • Fix typos found by codespell by @​DimitriPapadopoulos in actions/checkout#1287
  • Add support for sparse checkouts by @​dscho and @​dfdez in actions/checkout#1369
  • Release v3.5.3 by @​TingluoHuang in actions/checkout#1376

New Contributors

  • @​megamanics made their first contribution in actions/checkout#1196
  • @​DimitriPapadopoulos made their first contribution in actions/checkout#1287
  • @​dfdez made their first contribution in actions/checkout#1369

Full Changelog: https://github.com/actions/checkout/compare/v3...v3.5.3

v3.5.2

What's Changed

  • Fix: Use correct API url / endpoint in GHES by @​fhammerl in actions/checkout#1289 based on #1286 by @​1newsr

Full Changelog: https://github.com/actions/checkout/compare/v3.5.1...v3.5.2

v3.5.1

What's Changed

  • Improve checkout performance on Windows runners by upgrading @​actions/github dependency by @​BrettDong in actions/checkout#1246

New Contributors

  • @​BrettDong made their first contribution in actions/checkout#1246

title: Back integrate translations from TC
body:
This PR is to:
* Add Tibetan and Uighur for Flutter
* Update translations

Fixes: #155879

title: OpenGL external textures for Windows
body:
### Use case


Integrating video/picture rendering backends (e.g., GStreamer/ffmpeg) with Flutter can be challenging due to platform-specific texture handling.

**Current Approach:**

- Flutter recommends using [textures](https://api.flutter.dev/flutter/widgets/Texture-class.html): 
    > "Backend textures are images that can be applied (mapped) to an area of the Flutter view. They are created, managed, and updated using a platform-specific texture registry. This is typically done by a plugin that integrates with host platform video player, camera, or OpenGL APIs, or similar image sources." 


- **Windows limitations:**

    - **Pixel buffer textures:** Require memory juggling between GPU and CPU, potentially impacting performance for extreme use cases (e.g., rendering 16 video streams).
    - **D3D textures:** Difficult to use with OpenGL-only rendering backends due to the need for conversion between OpenGL and D3D textures.



### Proposal

- **Raw OpenGL texture support for Windows (hopefully across all platforms):** This would simplify integrations and potentially improve performance.

**Notes**
- See also https://medium.com/hackernoon/rendering-external-texture-an-flutter-optimization-by-alibaba-c5ed143af747 and https://www.reddit.com/r/flutterhelp/comments/1ibhhro/flutter_integration_with_opengl_like_apploica/
- My knowledge is based on current community libraries and the Flutter engine source code for external textures.
- I don't know if Impeller fixes something in that regard.
author: nrbnlulu

title: Don't depend on Dart from FML.
body:
This was likely a holdover from a time when trace events were routed to the timeline directly.

This was causing standalone QNX builds to also pull in Dart.

No change in functionality and hopefully faster builds for smaller targets.

title: Add FormField.errorBuilder
body:
## Description

This PR adds the `TextFormField.errorBuilder`property which makes it possible to customize the widget used to display the error message.

Implementation based on https://github.com/flutter/flutter/pull/156275#issuecomment-2521651828

## Related Issue

Fixes [Unable to use validator along with error widget in TextFormField](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/133629)
Fixes https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/135292

## Tests

Adds 1 tests.
author: bleroux

title: Help with Flutter Theming...
body:
I followed a YouTube tutorial to see how to use a dropdown menu to select and save a theme using `shared_preferences` and it worked flawlessly actually, so i thought maybe i can use and implement the same code (almost same actually) to select the `colorScheme` and eventually this is what i came up with:
```
theme: ThemeData(colorScheme: provider.seedColor)
darkTheme: ThemeData(colorScheme: provider.seedColor)
```

but for the theming(light/dark) to work, i need to set the theme like this:

```
theme: ThemeData.light()
darkTheme: ThemeData.dark()
```

but this way the `colorScheme` won't be set, so i use `copyWith()` this way:

```
theme: ThemeData.light().copyWith(colorScheme: provider.seedColor)
darkTheme: ThemeData.dark().copyWith(colorScheme: provider.seedColor)
```

but it's not the same as if i was using the first method:

```
theme: ThemeData(colorScheme: provider.seedColor)
darkTheme: ThemeData(colorScheme: provider.seedColor)
```

now you might not understand much without looking at the code so here:
https://pastebin.com/rYtWgjd9

IMPORTANT NOTE: if you want to run the app, try creating the `HomePage()` class specified in the code and creating a button for the settings page.

Please help and hanks in advance!

title: Migrating from podfiles to Package.swift: incompatibility in iOS versions
body:
### Steps to reproduce

Create or migrate an existing package, as explained in official materials: https://docs.flutter.dev/packages-and-plugins/swift-package-manager/for-plugin-authors

Set `Platforms` in your `Package.swift` to desired version, e.g:

```swift
    platforms: [
        .iOS(.v13),
    ],
```

Reference this package in your example application, as explained in: https://docs.flutter.dev/packages-and-plugins/swift-package-manager/for-app-developers

Set your `Minimum Deployment` to any number higher than package, e.g. `16.0`

The result is, project doesn't build. And while I can control my own packages's versions, I can't change versions of referenced packages, which lowers overall version in `FlutterGeneratedPluginSwiftPackage` and makes build failing.

### Expected results

Project builds, as it was with pods

### Actual results

Project fails to build

### Code sample

Not applicable here

### Flutter Doctor output

<details open><summary>Doctor output</summary>

```console
 flutter doctor
Doctor summary (to see all details, run flutter doctor -v):

```

</details>

title: Attempting to change channel bricks installation (Windows)
body:
### Steps to reproduce

1. Download a fresh Flutter SDK zip from the site (Windows)
2. Unzip it
3. Run doctor to verify it works correctly
4. Attempt to switch to beta branch (maybe master as well?)
5. Freshly bricked installation (cannot be undone, even with `git reset --hard`)

> The system cannot find the file specified.
e672b006cb34c921db85b8e2f482ed3144a4574b was unexpected at this time.

title: Pin `customer_testing` to the SHA specified in `tests.version` (#162048)
body:
Closes https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/162041.

I also converted the `.sh` and `.bat` files (largely) to Dart, mostly because I don't know enough Windows XP command prompt in order to make the change safely. They should still run the same from the CI bootstrapping, but most of the logic is now Dart code.

Will send a separate PR to update the `flutter/tests` PR template.

/cc @johnmccutchan @Piinks

Reviewers are typically assigned within a week of filing a request.

-->

title: Can't use Isolates in Flutter web, any workaround?
body:
### Steps to reproduce

1. Use any kind of Isolates in Flutter web project
2. Run on Chrome browser
3. Watch it burn giving following errors when doing `flutter run`:

Another exception was thrown: Instance of 'minified:iT<erased>'
Uncaught Error: Instance of 'minified:wg'
Uncaught Error: Unsupported operation: ReceivePort.sendPort


### Expected results

Isolates if not supported (seen https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/145132) should at least execute on the main thread to allow easy cross platform deployment.

### Actual results

Isolates crash on Web but run flawlessly on iOS.

### Code sample

Please create simple Flutter web app and try to create, spawn and compute in Isolate (not compute() function since https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/33577).

title: WASM ColorFilter.matrix translation column must be in range [0..255] but in Chrome is [0..1]
body:
### Steps to reproduce Hi there, I use ColorFilter.matirx for transform images. After updating to flutter 3.27.3 i trying use WASM mode, but get a problem with ColorFilter.matrix. Look's like a bag... Translation column in filter matrix must be in range from 0 to 255. But when i run release WASM build in chrome, ColorFilter.matrix isn't wotk. After few expirements i found that wasm build in chrome works as expected if translation column is in range 0-1, but not 0-255 (( Android and iOS build works properly. And WASM build in Safari browser also work correct with range 0-225. ### Expected results ColorFilter.matirx tranlation column in range 0-255 ### Actual results WASM build in Chrome, tranlation column for ColorFilter.matirx work only in range 0-1 ### Code sample
Code sample ```dart import 'package:flutter/material.dart'; void main() { runApp(const MyApp()); } class MyApp extends StatelessWidget { const MyApp({super.key}); final String title = 'Inverted image'; @override Widget build(BuildContext context) { return MaterialApp( title: title, theme: ThemeData( colorScheme: ColorScheme.fromSeed(seedColor: Colors.deepPurple), useMaterial3: true, ), home: MyHomePage(title: title), ); } } class MyHomePage extends StatelessWidget { const MyHomePage({super.key, required this.title}); final String title; static const List _invertMatrix1 = [ //R G B A * -1, 0, 0, 0, 1, // Red 0, -1, 0, 0, 1, // Green 0, 0, -1, 0, 1, // Blue 0, 0, 0, 1, 0, // Alpha ]; static const List _invertMatrix255 = [ //R G B A * -1, 0, 0, 0, 255, // Red 0, -1, 0, 0, 255, // Green 0, 0, -1, 0, 255, // Blue 0, 0, 0, 1, 0, // Alpha ]; @override Widget build(BuildContext context) { final imageWidget = Image.network("https://picsum.photos/id/447/200/300"); return Scaffold( appBar: AppBar( backgroundColor: Theme.of(context).colorScheme.inversePrimary, title: Text(title), ), body: Center( child: Wrap( alignment: WrapAlignment.center, spacing: 10.0, runSpacing: 10.0, children: [ Column(children: [Text("Translation 1"), ColorFiltered(colorFilter: ColorFilter.matrix(_invertMatrix1), child: imageWidget)]), Column(children: [Text("Translation 255"), ColorFiltered(colorFilter: ColorFilter.matrix(_invertMatrix255), child: imageWidget)]), Column(children: [Text("Raw"), imageWidget]), ], ), ), ); } } ```
### Screenshots or Video
Screenshots / flutter run --release -d chrome --wasm
Screenshots / flutter run --release -d chrome
Screenshots / Android emulator
Screenshots / iOS simulator
### Logs _No response_ ### Flutter Doctor output
Flutter doctor output ```console [✓] Flutter (Channel stable, 3.27.3, on macOS 15.2 24C101 darwin-arm64, locale uk-CZ) • Flutter version 3.27.3 on channel stable at /Users/*****/flutter • Upstream repository https://github.com/flutter/flutter.git • Framework revision c519ee916e (4 days ago), 2025-01-21 10:32:23 -0800 • Engine revision e672b006cb • Dart version 3.6.1 • DevTools version 2.40.2 [✓] Android toolchain - develop for Android devices (Android SDK version 35.0.0-rc3) • Android SDK at /Users/*****/Library/Android/sdk • Platform android-35, build-tools 35.0.0-rc3 • Java binary at: /Users/*****/Applications/Android Studio.app/Contents/jbr/Contents/Home/bin/java • Java version OpenJDK Runtime Environment (build 21.0.4+-12422083-b607.1) • All Android licenses accepted. [✓] Xcode - develop for iOS and macOS (Xcode 16.2) • Xcode at /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer • Build 16C5032a • CocoaPods version 1.16.2 [✓] Chrome - develop for the web • CHROME_EXECUTABLE = /Applications/Google Chrome.app/Contents/MacOS/Google Chrome [✓] Android Studio (version 2024.2) • Android Studio at /Users/*****/Applications/Android Studio.app/Contents • Flutter plugin can be installed from: 🔨 https://plugins.jetbrains.com/plugin/9212-flutter • Dart plugin can be installed from: 🔨 https://plugins.jetbrains.com/plugin/6351-dart • Java version OpenJDK Runtime Environment (build 21.0.4+-12422083-b607.1) [✓] VS Code (version 1.86.0) • VS Code at /Applications/Visual Studio Code.app/Contents • Flutter extension can be installed from: 🔨 https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=Dart-Code.flutter [✓] Connected device (6 available) • sdk gphone64 arm64 (mobile) • emulator-5554 • android-arm64 • Android 15 (API 35) (emulator) • iPhone ****** (mobile) • 00008120-***************** • ios • iOS 18.2.1 22C161 • macOS (desktop) • macos • darwin-arm64 • macOS 15.2 24C101 darwin-arm64 • Mac Designed for iPad (desktop) • mac-designed-for-ipad • darwin • macOS 15.2 24C101 darwin-arm64 • Chrome (web) • chrome • web-javascript • Google Chrome 131.0.6778.267 [✓] Network resources • All expected network resources are available. • No issues found! ```

title: Linux, MacOS and Windows support?!
body:
### Use case

Flutter is able to support many different desktops (Windows, Linux, MacOS). Is this plugin really not dependable?

### Proposal

If the plugin doesn't support Windows, Linux and MacOS, it should be updated to work.

title: Blur not working as expected with impeller on Samsung galaxy s22 and some other devices
body:
### Steps to reproduce

1. create new flutter project with flutter create
2. paste code from code sample to your main.dart file
3. run this app on Samsung Galaxy s22 (i know this issue persist across some other devices but don't know exactly on which) 

### Expected results

This is how blur expected to work video recorded on android emulator

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/75e0f379-99ee-45c6-af2f-9ec324f2e7eb

### Actual results

This video recorded on Samsung Galaxy s22 and it is not working properly

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1a36c260-1452-4a44-a856-c0221510b128

It works well If i add this meta-data in AndroidManifest.xml 


```
<meta-data
            android:name="io.flutter.embedding.android.EnableImpeller"
            android:value="false" /> 
```

### Code sample


<details open><summary>Code sample</summary>

```dart

import 'dart:ui';

import 'package:flutter/material.dart';

void main() {
  runApp(const App());
}

class App extends StatelessWidget {
  const App({super.key});

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return MaterialApp(
      title: 'Flutter Demo',
      theme: ThemeData(
        brightness: Brightness.dark,
        useMaterial3: true,
      ),
      darkTheme: ThemeData(brightness: Brightness.dark),
      themeMode: ThemeMode.dark,
      debugShowCheckedModeBanner: false,
      debugShowMaterialGrid: false,
      home: const HomePage(),
    );
  }
}

class HomePage extends StatelessWidget {
  const HomePage({super.key});

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Scaffold(
      appBar: AppBar(
        title: const Text('Home Page'),
      ),
      body: ListView.builder(
        itemBuilder: (context, index) {
          return SizedBox(
            height: 320,
            child: ListView.separated(
              padding: const EdgeInsets.symmetric(horizontal: 16),
              itemCount: 10,
              clipBehavior: Clip.none,
              scrollDirection: Axis.horizontal,
              itemBuilder: (context, index) {
                return ClipRRect(
                  borderRadius: BorderRadius.circular(8),
                  child: Image.network(
                    'https://picsum.photos/200/300',
                    width: 200,
                    height: 300,
                  ),
                );
              },
              separatorBuilder: (context, index) => SizedBox(width: 8),
            ),
          );
        },
      ),
      extendBody: true,
      bottomNavigationBar: RepaintBoundary(
        child: ClipRect(
          child: BackdropFilter(
            filter: ImageFilter.blur(sigmaX: 10, sigmaY: 10),
            child: Material(
              elevation: 10,
              color: Colors.black.withValues(alpha: 0.5),
              child: Padding(
                padding: EdgeInsets.fromLTRB(
                  30.0,
                  0,
                  30.0,
                  0,
                ),
                child: SizedBox(
                  height: 52,
                  width: double.infinity,
                  child: Row(
                    mainAxisAlignment: MainAxisAlignment.spaceBetween,
                    children: [],
                  ),
                ),
              ),
            ),
          ),
        ),
      ),
    );
  }
}

title: [CP][Impeller] when a command pool has many unused buffers, reset with release resources flag.
body:
Fixes https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/161861

Resetting a command pool is not sufficient to reclaim memory.  Contrary to what you would expect, it appears that just resetting the pool, even if the cmd buffers are reclaimed, never frees any memory unless this flag is provided.
author: jonahwilliams

title: Request to Support Overriding `libapp.so` on Android | To Enable Custom Code Push Feature
body:
Hi Flutter Team,

We are considering implementing a code-push-like feature for our Flutter Android app, similar to how react-native-code-push operates. After reviewing the Flutter Engine codebase, specifically this file: [FlutterLoader.java](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/blob/master/engine/src/flutter/shell/platform/android/io/flutter/embedding/engine/loader/FlutterLoader.java), we believe that supporting the ability to override `FlutterApplicationInfo.aotSharedLibraryName` at runtime would make it possible for us, or the community, to build a similar feature.

## How will we implement code push?

In a standard Flutter release APK, the app loads `libapp.so` by default. When a new patch is available, our custom implementation would download a new shared library (e.g., `libapp-arm64-v1.0.1.so`) specific to the device. The next time the app opens, we would use the downloaded `libapp-*.so` file, applying the patch. We could manage the correct library version to use by storing it in SharedPreferences or a similar local storage solution.



## Why not use existing solutions?

1. Shorebird.dev: It's not fully open source,
2. Flutter RFW: Implementing code push like solution using RFW adds High maintenance, complexity.


Although we could maintain a fork of Flutter internally with these changes, it seems to be a small modification within a few files under the path `engine/src/flutter/shell/platform/android/io/flutter/embedding/engine/loader/*`

## Security considerations

1. **No Impact for Apps Without Overrides:** Apps that don't implement this override will not be affected; only those with the code-push implementation will see changes.
2. **Compatibility Check:** If the newly downloaded libapp-*.so is incompatible with the app’s native build, it won’t load. so a `libapp.so` patch intended for a 3rd person shooter game is not going to work in basic calculator app.
3. **Similar to React-Native Code Push**: This approach mirrors how react-native handles code updates by delivering new `index.android.bundle` files. In this case, we'd be delivering `libapp-*.so` files, a technique that’s been widely used in production apps.



## Questions:

1. What are your thoughts on this approach?
2. Is there an existing way to achieve this that we may have missed?


Thanks for the amazing framework! We look forward to hearing your thoughts.

https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/14330
author: p2pdops

title: [Impeller] make swapchain related external fence/semaphore extensions optional.
body:
Fixes https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/162088

Since we will always support a fallback to the KHR swapchain on Android, we can make the external fence/semaphore extensions optional.
author: jonahwilliams

title: Conditionally skip the engine build phase
body:
We'll use the same logic we use for `runIf` to determine if the engine sources changed::

- `DEPS`
- `engine/**`

If there are >= 30 files _or_ one of the files above changed, we keep doing what we do now (i.e. build the engine before scheduling engine and framework tests).

Otherwise, in this new flow (TM):

- [x] We support `FLUTTER_PREBUILT_ENGINE_VERSION`:

    **MERGING**: https://github.com/flutter/flutter/pull/162118

- [x] We set `properties['flutter_prebuilt_engine_version']` = `github.event.pull_request.base.sha` ([in Cocoon](https://github.com/flutter/cocoon/blob/8b58cfaec8dc5d76a539bf5ee4439eb235ec5dd9/app_dart/lib/src/service/luci_build_service.dart#L327-L332))

  **MERGED**: https://github.com/flutter/cocoon/pull/4177

- [x] We update [LUCI recipes `repo_utils/api.py`](https://flutter.googlesource.com/recipes/+/refs/heads/main/recipe_modules/repo_util/api.py#448) to, if provided, use `flutter_prebuilt_engine_version` to set the environment variable `FLUTTER_ENGINE_VERSION={property}`.

    **MERGED**: https://flutter-review.googlesource.com/c/recipes/+/62501

- [x] Edit [`triggerPresubmitTargets`](https://github.com/flutter/cocoon/blob/8b58cfaec8dc5d76a539bf5ee4439eb235ec5dd9/app_dart/lib/src/service/scheduler.dart#L432-L453) to make the request for the list of files [before computing presubmit targets](https://github.com/flutter/cocoon/blob/8b58cfaec8dc5d76a539bf5ee4439eb235ec5dd9/app_dart/lib/src/service/scheduler.dart#L432).

    **MERGED**: https://github.com/flutter/cocoon/pull/4178

    **MERGED**: https://github.com/flutter/cocoon/pull/4185

This, combined with the work we already did/are doing, see https://github.com/flutter/flutter/pull/162118, means that we'll fetch and use an older engine artifact.

---

There is _future_ work to do to expand beyond the 30 file limit (see https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/161462), but we believe this would address many framework-only PRs _today_, allowing us to fix the limitations we have today of understanding what files changed (and eventually move towards something like a precomputed build plan).
author: matanlurey

title: [canvaskit] Fix debug build for CanvasKit
body:
Fixes the debug build for CanvasKit.

NOTE: We need to build the debug WASM build with `-O1` because building with `-O0` causes Emscripten to produce a binary that is rejected by Chrome for having functions with too many local variables. Building with `-O1` optimizes those locals out.

title: [CP][Impeller] Skip clip entity replay that cannot impact current clip. (#162113)
body:
Fixes https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/161262

Sometimes we end up with clip replay entities that have clip depth values substantially below the current depth. I suspect this is due to either mismatched save/restore or a bug in our code. Update: this isn't a bug/bug but its definitely a bug. We can have multiple clips per save, but the restore will remove at most one from the record/replay.


If a clip has a depth value that is less than the current clip depth, it cannot by definition impact anything that draws after it.
author: jonahwilliams

title: [CP][Impeller] Update partial repaint to use a fullsize onscreen. (#161626)
body:
The existing technique of offsetting a smaller texture is very vunerable to bugs in the renderer. Rather than this approach, we can allocate a new offscreen that is full sized and then blit a smaller region. To reduce the allocation costs, we can also set up a transients cache which will reuse this texture. In total, this should be more performant than the existing partial repaint (due to lack of continual re-allocation) at the cost of higher peak memory usage.

Fixes https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/140877 Fixes https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/160588 Fixes https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/156113
author: jonahwilliams

title: [CP][Impeller] when mips are disabled, also disable from sampler options (#161765)
body: If we have disabled mipmap generation on a platform due to GPU driver bugs, make sure that all sampling options used declare that only the base mip level should be read. Otherwise we can end up sampling from unpopulated mip levels.
author: jonahwilliams

title: [CP][Impeller] use 3 fences to synchronize AHB swapchains (like we do for KHR)
body: Testing on a newer Adreno, I can still see rendering artifacts. This change matches the syncrhonization to what we do for KHR, and on the Adreno I see no more rendering artifacts.
author: jonahwilliams

title: [CP][Impeller] remove Adreno denylist entries. (#161740)
body:
Fixes https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/161209

testing on a 540 and everything seems to work now that we have the Adreno specific workarounds added to the renderer. Its possible there are some bugs that only exist on the early 600s but I guess we'll find out.
author: jonahwilliams

title: [CP][Impellerc] correctly pad arrays of vec3s in reflector. (#161697)
body:
When processing the metadata for a struct with an array, incorporate the padding into the layout. Previously we would register a vec3[n] array as being 4*n bytes (including the padding), but when uploading this would result in us writing data into the padding and then leave the rest uninitialized. now we correctly insert a padding element between 3 byte elements.

Fixes https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/161645
author: jonahwilliams

title: [CP][Impeller] adjust coverage origin when rounding out SaveLayer bounds  (#161838)
body:
Fixes https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/161374

When we round out the texture size for a saveLayer, also round out the coverage so that the drawing origin is correct. Otherwise we may actually cut off the top left edge of rendering.
author: jonahwilliams

title: [CP][impeller] prevent PowerVR from using Vulkan backend. (#161841)
body: Almost all remaining blackscreen or rendering bugs/crashes are PowerVR hardware. Based on common knowledge that several large engines prevent PowerVR completely, we'll also block PowerVR until we have time to accumulate the necessary workarounds.
author: jonahwilliams

title: [CP][Impeller] check both linear sampling props for AHBs. (#162043)
body:
According to
https://github.com/KhronosGroup/Vulkan-ValidationLayers/issues/5806 , both eSampledImageYcbcrConversionLinearFilter and
eSampledImageFilterLinear properties are required to use a linear chromaFilter.
author: jonahwilliams

title: Request to Release Updated Flutter 1.22.6 Compatible with Current Xcode (ENABLE_BITCODE=NO)
body: Dear Flutter Team, I hope this message finds you well. We are working on a project that is dependent on Flutter 1.22.6 (released on January 25, 2021). Due to the project's complexity and the extensive use of dependencies that do not support null safety, updating to a more recent version of Flutter is currently unfeasible. However, with the latest Xcode updates and evolving iOS requirements, maintaining compatibility with older Flutter versions has become challenging. Specifically, having Flutter 1.22.6 configured to work with the latest Xcode (with ENABLE_BITCODE=NO) would be immensely helpful for projects like ours that are bound to older versions. Would it be possible for the Flutter team to release an updated version of Flutter 1.22.6 (or another stable 1.x version) that ensures compatibility with current iOS requirements? This update would greatly assist teams facing similar constraints in maintaining their projects. While issues with Pods that use ENABLE_BITCODE can be resolved using workarounds like the one detailed [here](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/79019897/flutterxcode-16-cardinalmobile-framework-ppriskmagnes-contains-bitcode), these fixes do not address the compatibility issues with Flutter 1.22.6 itself. This makes it very difficult to get older projects running on current iOS environments. Here the Xcode validation script. Thank you for your continued support and understanding. I appreciate your consideration of this request. Best regards, Cassio
author: cassioseffrin

title: Flutter 3.27.x | Android 10, 11 | Crash: "drawRenderNode called on a context with no surface!"
body:
### Steps to reproduce

**Issue Summary:**

Our app uses multiple screens with WebView (flutter_inappwebview). After upgrading Flutter from version 3.24.4 to 3.27.1 to address [this issue](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/158961) on iOS 18.2, we started receiving a large number of crash reports on Android.

**Steps to Reproduce:**

1. Open and close multiple WebView screens (approximately 5–10 screens).
2. Open another WebView screen. While it attempts to render, press the Home button to minimize the app.
3. Reopen the app from the background right after that.
4. Observed Behavior: The app shows a black screen, ANR logs, and then crashes.

**Additional Notes:**

**1. Impeller Disabled:**
Due to [this issue](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/160442), Impeller is disabled on Android:
```xml
<meta-data
    android:name="io.flutter.embedding.android.EnableImpeller"
    android:value="false" />
```
**2. Crash Details:**
- Crashes occur 100% of the time on devices running Android 10 and 11.
- Tested builds:
  - **Flutter 3.24.4 & 3.24.5**: No crashes observed on a Nokia 8.1 (Android 11).
  - **Flutter 3.27.1 & 3.27.3**: Crashes consistently occur on the same device (Nokia 8.1, Android 11).


### Expected results

Android app should not be crashed

### Actual results

App crashes 

### Code sample

<details open><summary>Code sample</summary>

```dart
[Paste your code here]
```

</details>


### Screenshots or Video

<details open>
<summary>Screenshots / Video demonstration</summary>

[Upload media here]

</details>


### Logs

**Android 11:**

title: Android phone backend enters app flashing
body:
### Steps to reproduce

1.When I enter the Flutter application from the background on my Samsung phone, it will have a semi black mask flashing
2.But when I click on the icon on the homepage of my phone to enter the app, it won't flash

### Expected results

On Samsung phones, it is necessary to enter the front desk normally without blinking.

### Actual results

I'm sorry for mentioning the same issue before, but I couldn't find a solution at the time. However, today I found a solution and added some methods to MainActivity to solve the flickering problem. Can we fix this type of problem in future versions

### Code sample

import android.os.Bundle
import androidx.activity.enableEdgeToEdge
import io.flutter.embedding.android.FlutterActivityLaunchConfigs.BackgroundMode
import io.flutter.embedding.android.FlutterFragmentActivity
import io.flutter.embedding.engine.FlutterEngine
import io.flutter.plugins.GeneratedPluginRegistrant

class MainActivity : FlutterFragmentActivity() {
    override fun onCreate(savedInstanceState: Bundle?) {
        super.onCreate(savedInstanceState)
        enableEdgeToEdge()
    }

    override fun configureFlutterEngine(flutterEngine: FlutterEngine) {
        GeneratedPluginRegistrant.registerWith(flutterEngine)
    }

    override fun getBackgroundMode(): BackgroundMode {
        return BackgroundMode.transparent
    }
}

### Screenshots or Video

#160857 

### Logs

_No response_

title: Regarding the issue of flashing apps when entering the Android background of Samsung phones
body:
### Steps to reproduce

1.When I enter the Flutter application from the background on my Samsung phone, it will have a semi black mask flashing
2.But when I click on the icon on the homepage of my phone to enter the app, it won't flash

### Expected results

On Samsung phones, it is necessary to enter the front desk normally without blinking.

### Actual results

I'm sorry for mentioning the same issue before, but I couldn't find a solution at the time. However, today I found a solution and added some methods to MainActivity to solve the flickering problem. Can we fix this type of problem in future versions

### Code sample

import android.os.Bundle
import androidx.activity.enableEdgeToEdge
import io.flutter.embedding.android.FlutterActivityLaunchConfigs.BackgroundMode
import io.flutter.embedding.android.FlutterFragmentActivity
import io.flutter.embedding.engine.FlutterEngine
import io.flutter.plugins.GeneratedPluginRegistrant

class MainActivity : FlutterFragmentActivity() {
    override fun onCreate(savedInstanceState: Bundle?) {
        super.onCreate(savedInstanceState)
        enableEdgeToEdge()
    }

    override fun configureFlutterEngine(flutterEngine: FlutterEngine) {
        GeneratedPluginRegistrant.registerWith(flutterEngine)
    }

    override fun getBackgroundMode(): BackgroundMode {
        return BackgroundMode.transparent
    }
}

Impact Description: DropdownMenu's menuChildren might be placed somewhere far from menuAnchor. https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/159906 and https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/161437

Workaround: Not known

Risk: Low. This CP reverts a PR, which is by itself a incorrect bug fix.

title: Support hot restart for DDC library bundle format
body:
https://github.com/dart-lang/webdev/issues/2516
https://github.com/dart-lang/webdev/issues/2561

- Adds logic to emit newly compiled sources to a file that can be read by the bootstrapper.
- Adds bootstrapping logic to reload scripts as needed. This involves implementing the necessary hot restart callback, fetching and processing the emitted file of newly compiled sources, cache busting, and loading the scripts onto the page. A lot of this logic is similar or identical to what we have for internal hot restart support.
- Runs existing hot restart tests with the new bundle format.
- Adds meta tag to run with utf-8 like in https://github.com/flutter/flutter/pull/161493.
- Uses DWDS 24.3.3.

title: Formalize `update_engine_version.{sh|ps1}`.
body:
Towards https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/162201.

**NOTE**: This renames the environment variable to `FLUTTER_PREBUILT_ENGINE_VERSION`.

---

We occasionally break ourselves, our users, and the Dart up (or is it down? side-ways) stream repos (i.e. HHH) when we change how the undocumented [`update_engine_version.sh`](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/blob/master/bin/internal/update_engine_version.sh) script, and it's Windows counterpart [`update_engine_version.ps1`](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/blob/master/bin/internal/update_engine_version.ps1) work, but have no way of knowing until N days/weeks later when someone tells us.

For example, <https://flutter-review.googlesource.com/c/recipes/+/62400>.

This is my attempt to encode "this is what you can guarantee by calling this script".

It _still_ will be an internal only API that we might rev at any time, but at least we:

1. Can tell the Dart team "this is tested and how it works"
2. If we want to change it, the tests will keep us from changing it without informing folks it changed

These tests should (in theory) cover both Linux/MacOS and Windows.

/cc @a-siva
author: matanlurey

I encountered an issue when using local_auth. It requires FlutterFragmentActivity, so I replaced FlutterActivity with FlutterFragmentActivity. While this initially seemed to work fine, the app crashes if the user presses the home button and then returns to the app after some time. This issue occurs even in basic Flutter applications.

### Expected results

Is there a way to use flutteractivity with local_auth?

### Actual results

the app crashes if the user presses the home button and then returns to the app after some time
author: MohoPina

title: [Impeller] Skip clip entity replay that cannot impact current clip.
body:
Fixes https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/161262

Sometimes we end up with clip replay entities that have clip depth values substantially below the current depth. I suspect this is due to either mismatched save/restore or a bug in our code. Update: this isn't a bug/bug but its definitely a bug. We can have multiple clips per save, but the restore will remove at most one from the record/replay.


If a clip has a depth value that is less than the current clip depth, it cannot by definition impact anything that draws after it.

title: Fix skwasm target in wasm_debug_unopt build.
body:
Fixes a couple issues in the skwasm build rules:
* `DEMANGLE_SUPPORT` is deprecated in emscripten, so just remove it.
* `sSHARED_MEMORY=1` needs to be added to the cflags so that emscripten appends the proper feature flags (`-matomics` and `-mbulk-memory`) when doing the compile so that the flags match the linking step.

title: Force Impeller backend for `android_engine_test`, and test both OpenGLES and Vulkan
body:
A few changes in this PR (could have been split up, but that would take an extra 4 hours - 2 days in CI time):

- Removed the old `flutter_driver_android_test` shards and references
- Override `AndroidManifest.xml` per backend, forcing that backend to be used (no fallbacks) or it fails
- Bumps the Android emulator to 35 due to the use of magic strings, I think

The check for the Impeller backend actually being used is the honor system right now, as a bug in `flutter drive` (https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/162087) prevents me from seeing error output, meaning that it's impossible to be sure a particular Impeller backend is used (or understand why a crash happens), so I guess I'll work on that next.

Due to https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/162088, we were accidentally running our Vulkan tests as OpenGLES 🤦🏼 .
author: matanlurey

title: [Impeller] make AHB swapchain required extensions optional to restore some emulator support.
body: Previously we tried to unconditionally use AHB based swapchains, but for various reasons this did not pan out. We're still marking a series of AHB interop extensions as required, whereas they can be optional now. This is preventing the usage of Vulkan on API 34 emulators.

title: [Impeller] Make glIsTexture mockable for use by the ReactorGLES.NameUntrackedHandle test
body:
ReactorGLES.NameUntrackedHandle calls SetDebugLabel, which invokes glIsTexture.  glIsTexture should return a GLboolean.  But the mock GLES resolver was mapping glIsTexture to a no-op function with a void return type.

This change makes glIsTexture mockable so the test can ensure that it returns the appropriate result.

title: MissingPluginException no longer works with additional ViewControllers
body:
### Steps to reproduce

1. adding watchKit with this tutorial: https://github.com/theamorn/flutter-apple-watch/tree/main
2. adding additional SplashController with this tutorial:  https://medium.com/@turkergurel19/native-animated-splash-screen-with-lottie-in-flutter-21761532813b
3. try to work with MethodChannel

### Expected results

I try to implement watchkit to my app with this tutorial:

https://github.com/theamorn/flutter-apple-watch/tree/main

It is working perfectly. WCSession is working and invokeMethod as well.

But since I want to have an animated LaunchScreen, I have built a SplashController according to this tutorial and then change the rootViewController within the SplashController:

https://medium.com/@turkergurel19/native-animated-splash-screen-with-lottie-in-flutter-21761532813b

`appDelegate.window?.rootViewController = flutterViewController`

### Actual results

After adding the LaunchScreen, the invokeMethod function no longer works and the sending between watch and iPhone as well. I get the following error:

```
[ERROR:flutter/runtime/dart_vm_initializer.cc(40)] Unhandled Exception: MissingPluginException(No implementation found for method forwardToAppleWatch on channel com.XXX.app.watchkitapp)
#0      MethodChannel._invokeMethod (package:flutter/src/services/platform_channel.dart:332:7)
<asynchronous suspension>
```

### Code sample

<details open><summary>Code sample</summary>

I have the following AppDelegate in Xcode:


```dart

import UIKit
import Flutter
import WatchConnectivity

@main
@objc class AppDelegate: FlutterAppDelegate {
    
    let flutterEngine = FlutterEngine(name: "XXX")
    
    private var session: WCSession?
    private var channel: FlutterMethodChannel?
    
    override func application(
        _ application: UIApplication,
        didFinishLaunchingWithOptions launchOptions: [UIApplication.LaunchOptionsKey: Any]?
    ) -> Bool {
        // Runs the default Dart entrypoint with a default Flutter route.
         flutterEngine.run()
        
        // Watch
        initWatchConnectivity()
        initFlutterChannel()
        
        // Used to connect plugins (only if you have plugins with iOS platform code).
         GeneratedPluginRegistrant.register(with: self.flutterEngine)
        
      //  GeneratedPluginRegistrant.register(with: self)
        
        if #available(iOS 10.0, *) {
            UNUserNotificationCenter.current().delegate = self as? UNUserNotificationCenterDelegate
        }
        return super.application(application, didFinishLaunchingWithOptions: launchOptions)
    }
    
    private func initWatchConnectivity() {
        guard WCSession.isSupported() else { return }
        session = WCSession.default
        session?.delegate = self
        session?.activate()
    }
    
    private func initFlutterChannel() {
        DispatchQueue.main.async {
            guard let controller = self.window?.rootViewController as? FlutterViewController else { return }
            
            let channel = FlutterMethodChannel(name: "com.XXX.app.watchkitapp", binaryMessenger: controller.binaryMessenger)
            channel.setMethodCallHandler { [weak self] call, result in
                let method = call.method
                let args = call.arguments
                
                guard method == "forwardToAppleWatch" else { return }
                guard let watchSession = self?.session, watchSession.isPaired, let messageData = args as? [String: Any] else {
                    print("watch not paired")
                    return
                }
                
                guard watchSession.isReachable else {
                    print("watch not reachable")
                    return
                }
                
                watchSession.sendMessage(messageData, replyHandler: nil, errorHandler: nil)
            }
            self.channel = channel
        }
    }
    
}

extension AppDelegate: WCSessionDelegate {
    func sessionDidBecomeInactive(_ session: WCSession) { }
    func sessionDidDeactivate(_ session: WCSession) { }
    func session(_ session: WCSession, activationDidCompleteWith activationState: WCSessionActivationState, error: Error?) { }
    
    func session(_ session: WCSession, didReceiveMessage message: [String : Any]) {
        guard let methodName = message["method"] as? String else { return }
        let data: [String: Any]? = message["data"] as? [String: Any]
        channel?.invokeMethod(methodName, arguments: data)
    }
}

```

</details>

title: [impeller] Fonts are blurry on Galaxy S10 Android 12
body:
### Steps to reproduce

When running https://github.com/flutter/packages/tree/main/packages/webview_flutter/webview_flutter/example

On Galaxy S10 Android 12 I get very blurry fonts.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/002aa129-9deb-4ab5-b84a-901e7e11a25b)

Running the same example using `flutter run --no-enable-impeller` renders the fonts without blur.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/615db68b-c095-4503-bc39-bf3476cd4406)

The Pixel 3 Android 11 emulator seems to render fonts without blur.
Galaxy S8 Lineage OS 14 also renders fonts without blur.

Possibly related https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/161875

### Expected results

Fonts without blur.

### Actual results

Fonts with blur.

### Code sample

Use the example from here https://github.com/flutter/packages/tree/main/packages/webview_flutter/webview_flutter/example

author: Tartl3

title: [SwiftPM] FlutterGeneratedPluginSwiftPackage uses Flutter's minimum iOS version, instead of looking at project settings
body:
### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a new Flutter project with Flutter 3.27 or higher
2. Ensure that the project uses SwiftPM
3. Add the following dependencies to the project: (see the attached pubspec.lock for exact versions)
```
firebase_analytics: ^11.4.1
firebase_core: ^3.10.1
firebase_crashlytics: ^4.3.1
firebase_messaging: ^15.2.1
```
4. Specify a higher minimum iOS version, per the Firebase requirement
- `IPHONEOS_DEPLOYMENT_TARGET = 13.0;` in `ios/Runnerxcodeproj/project.pbxproj`
- `MinimumOSVersion` to `13.0` in `ios/Flutter/AppFrameworkInfo.plist`
- `platform :ios, '13.0'` in `ios/Podfile`
- override the minimum ios deployment target for pods using the following in the Podfile

```
post_install do |installer|
  installer.pods_project.targets.each do |target|
    flutter_additional_ios_build_settings(target)
    target.build_configurations.each do |config|
      config.build_settings['IPHONEOS_DEPLOYMENT_TARGET'] = '13.0'
    end
  end
end
```
5. Try to build the iOS app in XCode
6. The build fails with an error like the following: (see the screenshot)
```
The package product 'firebase-analytics' requires minimum platform version 13.0 for the iOS platform, but this target supports 12.0
The package product 'firebase-core' requires minimum platform version 13.0 for the iOS platform, but this target supports 12.0
The package product 'firebase-crashlytics' requires minimum platform version 13.0 for the iOS platform, but this target supports 12.0
The package product 'firebase-messaging' requires minimum platform version 13.0 for the iOS platform, but this target supports 12.0
```

### Expected results

The used Firebase versions require iOS 13.0 or higher. Thus the project specifies this in the project settings.
The generated `FlutterGeneratedPluginSwiftPackage/Package.swift` file should use the project level minimum supported version, as defined in the project.

Perhaps the `MinimumOSVersion` in `ios/Flutter/AppFrameworkInfo.plist` is a good candidate for this.
And MacOS probably also needs to be considered.

### Actual results

The build fails due to the minimum iOS version in the `FlutterGeneratedPluginSwiftPackage/Package.swift` being _Flutter's_ minimum iOS version.

See the attached `FlutterGeneratedPluginSwiftPackage/Package.swift` for an example.
Note: The project where I reproduced this also used other dependencies in the `FlutterGeneratedPluginSwiftPackage/Package.swift`, but those do not seem to be related to the issue.

The culprit _might_ be the hardcoded versions in https://github.com/flutter/flutter/blob/9ded795e6396e0a38faabb7c64f846dd6e54c682/packages/flutter_tools/lib/src/macos/swift_package_manager.dart#L33-L43

### Code sample

[pubspec_lock.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18520900/pubspec_lock.txt)

[Package_swift.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18520911/Package_swift.txt)


### Screenshots or Video

<details open>
<summary>Screenshots / Video demonstration</summary>

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/127e8253-234e-4eff-85cb-214358a3a9e9)

</details>


### Logs

title: Unable to load libflutter.so causing crash on Samsung Android 7.1.2 (i686 architecture) with libdatastore_shared_counter.so
body:
### Steps to reproduce

The following log is from a Firebase Crashlytics report




### Expected results

The app crashes during initialization. 

### Actual results

**Device Details:**

Device: Samsung Galaxy S10 5G
OS: Android 7.1.2
CPU Architecture: i686

**Description:**
When running the Flutter application on a Samsung device with Android 7.1.2, the app crashes during initialization. The issue is related to the inability to load libflutter.so, which seems to be caused by the device's architecture (i686) being unsupported by Flutter Android. Additionally, the native libraries directory contains libdatastore_shared_counter.so, which may contribute to the issue.

### Logs

<details open><summary>Logs</summary>

```
Fatal Exception: java.lang.RuntimeException
Unable to create application com.hfc.carloan.MainApplication: java.lang.RuntimeException: java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException: java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException: Could not load libflutter.so this is possibly because the application is running on an architecture that Flutter Android does not support (e.g. x86) see https://docs.flutter.dev/deployment/android#what-are-the-supported-target-architectures for more detail. App is using cpu architecture: i686, and the native libraries directory (with path /data/app/com.hfc.carloan-1/lib/x86) contains the following files: [libdatastore_shared_counter.so]

Fatal Exception: java.lang.RuntimeException: Unable to create application com.hfc.carloan.MainApplication: java.lang.RuntimeException: java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException: java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException: Could not load libflutter.so this is possibly because the application is running on an architecture that Flutter Android does not support (e.g. x86) see https://docs.flutter.dev/deployment/android#what-are-the-supported-target-architectures for more detail.
App is using cpu architecture: i686, and the native libraries directory (with path /data/app/com.hfc.carloan-1/lib/x86) contains the following files: [libdatastore_shared_counter.so]
       at android.app.ActivityThread.handleBindApplication(ActivityThread.java:5463)
       at android.app.ActivityThread.-wrap2(ActivityThread.java)
       at android.app.ActivityThread$H.handleMessage(ActivityThread.java:1548)
       at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:102)
       at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:154)
       at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:6176)
       at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java)
       at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:893)
       at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:783)
```

title: Started adjusting uvs to match pixel snapping.
body:
issue: https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/149652
doc: (currently google only) https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Rulw_noQi0G8Glb47vk17uBbb6sySDxlQe-l-0kHn14/edit?tab=t.0

This increases the RMSE value in the test in https://github.com/flutter/flutter/pull/161445 by a slight amount.  I do believe this reduces the time where we get non uniform scalars and protects the integrity of relative spacing, thus being more what we expect.  There is still a bug that has to do with pixel alignment that does give the illusion of stretching and shrinking though because of hard/soft lines.

author: matanlurey

title: flutter_tools: flutter_tester is a host artifact
body:
This resolves the case where a `flutter test` run is invoked on a target iOS/Android device, as in `flutter test -d iOS-device`.

Previously `CachedLocalEngineArtifacts` was returning `flutter_tester` from the local target build directory. `flutter_tester` is a host build artifact and thus should be returned from the local host engine directory, not the local target build directory.

Some history: A long time ago, desktop artifacts were produced as part of the host builds; and in fact, they still are, but ideally shouldn't be. At some point we added target builds for macOS, Windows, and Linux embedders, but failed to clean the target artifacts out of the host builds. Similarly, the desktop target builds should ideally not produce host artifacts, but that's less problematic. The conflation of the two is likely why the existing code was working until now.

Related issue: https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/38935

Closes: https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/162045

title: [flutter_tools] Return local flutter_tester from host build
body:
`CachedLocalEngineArtifacts` is returning `flutter_tester` from the local target build directory. `flutter_tester` is a host build artifact and thus should be returned from the local host engine directory, not the local target build directory.

This causes a crash when `flutter test` run is invoked on a target iOS/Android device, as in `flutter test -d iOS-device`.

Some history: A long time ago, desktop artifacts were produced as part of the host builds; and in fact, they still are, but ideally shouldn't be. At some point we added target builds for macOS, Windows, and Linux embedders, but failed to clean the target artifacts out of the host builds. Similarly, the desktop target builds should ideally not produce host artifacts, but that's less problematic. The conflation of the two is likely why the existing code was working until now.

Related issue: https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/38935
author: cbracken

title: [Impeller] check both linear sampling props for AHBs.
body: According to https://github.com/KhronosGroup/Vulkan-ValidationLayers/issues/5806 , both eSampledImageYcbcrConversionLinearFilter and eSampledImageFilterLinear properties are required to use a linear chromaFilter.

This adds a `bringup: true` node that duplicates what `Mac mac_clang_tidy` is doing, to be turned down/up in a follow-up.
author: matanlurey

title: Pin flutter/tests in flutter/flutter
body:
Right now, customer_testing pulls ~tip-of-tree of the flutter/tests repo

https://github.com/flutter/flutter/blob/06c3c93d72e1a632cf5dd61664a41b32d950c3de/dev/customer_testing/ci.sh#L34

This causes Flutter CI tree redness due to out-of-band updates to the flutter/tests repo.

We can solve the out-of-band breakage by pinning flutter/tests in flutter/flutter.

We could do that by adding a file to flutter/flutter (next to that `ci.sh` script) that contains the flutter/tests commit hash to pull. Then in `ci.sh`, we'd pull that commit hash instead of computing the commit hash (which is usually tip-of-tree flutter/tests) with the current script.

How to avoid flutter/tests hash becoming stale? We can add text to the flutter/tests PR template loudly asking committers there to activate their flutter/tests change by updating the hash checked into the file in flutter/flutter.

cc @johnmccutchan @jtmcdole @Piinks @matanlurey

author: mdebbar

title: [DisplayList] Move nested canvas enums into their own TU.
body:
These cause ambiguous compiler reference errors on some GCC versions. And, the errors seem right. But, newer versions of clang seem to resolve that ambiguity by also checking if the references to the types are also references to identical types.

Per the chat with Jim, also added the Dl prefix to those types.

No change in functionality. Just a rename of the types and removal of the now unnecessary typedefs.

title: Add piping and bringup nodes for `_vulkan` and `_opengles` suites.
body:
Towards https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/161333.

This adds the initial `.ci.yaml` configuration (marked `bringup: true`), without changing the existing shard to avoid the problems we ran into last time when I renamed the shard atomically, as well as piping for providing context in which the test will run (Vulkan or OpenGLES), which can't be introspected in the _running_ app.

In a follow-up PR I'll:

- Edit `AndroidManifest.xml` before the suite, setting `ImpellerBackend` appropriately
- Move the bringup nodes to presubmit
- Delete the existing (legacy) node
