title: onScaleStart/onScaleUpdate callback for Draggable
body:
### Use case

Hello! Thank you for reading and considering my feature request.

I started developing Flutter apps 4 months ago and it has been an awesome experience so far! :)

The problem I ran into that led me to request this feature is:

I wanted to implement a feature where I can drag items (say cards) into different buckets. I was amazed at how easy this was to achieve with DragTarget and Draggable. However, the next feature we wanted was to be able to scale and rotate the card before dropping it in.

I tried a combination of Draggable and GestureDetector and the onScaleStart and onScaleUpdate doesn't get called. I also found a few old posts about this:

https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/28202
https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/64428

Thanks again for the time! I would also appreciate any pointers on how to do this with the existing framework capabilities.

### Proposal

I would like to be able to scale and rotate a Draggable widget. 

I am proposing exposing callbacks for onScaleStart/Update/End or supporting another way to access these callbacks.
author: kirstenkoa

title: [native assets] Roll dependencies
body:
This PR rolls in a number of breaking changes for native assets:

* Pub workspaces are now supported, this requires a refactoring to how the `NativeAssetsBuildRunner` is used. Most notably it requires being explicit about the `runPackageName`. Flutter does not seem to have that value, but it does have the `projectUri` which can be used to find the package name via the package config.
* The API for build hooks has been redesigned. This PR updates the project template, test project files, and test project strings.

title: flutter-triage-bot aggressively remove fyi-* labels.
body:
When flutter-triage-bot detects an unnecessary fyi label, e.g both team-ios and fyi-ios are present, it will proceed to remove the fyi-ios  label. However, it seems to be aggressively remove not only the fyi-ios, but all fyi-* labels.

See example: https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/161081#issuecomment-2597147371

The expected behavior should be removing only the violating labels.

title: MacOS Flutter + Firebase: App works in debug but not in release
body:
I have built an app in flutter + firebase for macOS.

I am using macOS to authenticate the user and display some basic information.

Everything works great in debug mode and I am able to authenticate users properly without a single problem. The complete code even works great on windows.

But when I create a .dmg file of my product, I am again and again getting this error in the console provided by Mac:
11.4.2 - [FirebaseCore][I-COR000005] No app has been configured yet

The app opens, loads like it should and then closes as soon as it needs to sign in.

All the solutions are for iOS where they ask to change ios/AppDelegate.swift but I am building for macOS and that file is completely different.

I am new to the MacOS ecosystem and it is very difficult for me to understand what the error may be.
author: Shashwat2708

title: Avoid iOS text selection crash by returning nil range
body:
[Previously approved](https://github.com/flutter/engine/pull/55909) in /engine before monorepo shift.

Reverts an unnecessary assertion introduced by [#16496](https://github.com/flutter/engine/pull/16496) that crashes upon valid user text field interactions. Follow-on work can resolve the underlying discrepancy between iOS and Flutter range finding (see #160100). For crash reports, see issue [#138464](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/138464).

title: Expand the `.ci.yaml` and `builder.json` linter
body:
Closes https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/161823.

Other than the integration test included, example output looks like this:

```dart
# Assuming you are in $ENGINE/src/flutter
% dart tools/pkg/engine_build_configs/bin/check.dart --help
-v, --verbose                                  Enable noisier diagnostic output
-h, --help                                     Output usage information.
    --engine-src-path=</path/to/engine/src>    (defaults to "/Users/matanl/Developer/flutter/engine/src")

% dart tools/pkg/engine_build_configs/bin/check.dart       
✅ Loaded build configs under ci/builders
✅ .ci.yaml at .ci.yaml is valid
✅ All configuration files are valid
✅ All builds within a builder are uniquely named
✅ All build names must have a conforming prefix
✅ All builder files conform to release_build standards
```

I allow-listed a single case that needs to be moved, but I think this provides value already.

author: kentnguyen99

title: Flutter crashes when accessing C global memory from pointers
body:
### Steps to reproduce

In my real use case, I am trying to access a C file that contains an array of globals, but whenever I access a member of that array, Flutter unexpectedly quits on me. I recreated a smaller example to share using the below steps (my apologies for how long this example is, this is the most I could cut the example down while maintaining the structure my code has):

1. Create new flutter project.1. In the root directory of the project, run `flutter create --platforms=android,ios,macos,windows,linux --template=plugin_ffi pointer_plugin`

1. Add the new plugin to the `pubspec.yaml` with 

    ```
    dependencies:
        pointer_plugin:
            path: pointer_plugin
    ```

1. In `/pointer_plugin/src/pointer_plugin.h`, add the following lines:

    ```
    FFI_PLUGIN_EXPORT extern int globalFoo;
    FFI_PLUGIN_EXPORT extern int globals[];
    ```

1. Create new file globals.c  in `/pointer_plugin/src` and add the following lines:

    ```
    #include "pointer_plugin.h"
    FFI_PLUGIN_EXPORT int globalFoo = 42;
    FFI_PLUGIN_EXPORT int globals[] = {3, 2, 1};
    ```

1. Add `src/globals.c` to `/pointer_plugin/ffigen.yaml` under headers.entry-points:

    ```
    headers:
      entry-points:
        - 'src/pointer_plugin.h'
        - 'src/globals.c'
    ````

1. Add `src/globals.c` to `/pointer_plugin/src/CMakeLists.txt` in add_library:

    ```
    add_library(pointer_plugin SHARED
      "pointer_plugin.c"
      "globals.c"
    )
    ```

1. Run ffigen in /pointer_plugin using `dart run ffigen --config ffigen.yaml`. This creates `/pointer_plugin/lib/pointer_plugin_bindings_generated.dart`

1. In `/pointer_plugin/lib/pointer_plugin.dart`, create functions that access the globals declared above:

    ```
    int getGlobal() => _bindings.globalFoo;
    Pointer<Int> getGlobals() => _bindings.globals;
    ```

1.  In `/lib/main.dart`, import pointer_plugin and dart:ffi with:

    ```
    import 'dart:ffi';
    import 'package:pointer_plugin/pointer_plugin.dart' as pointer_plugin;
    ````


1. In `/lib/main.dart`, replace the contents of `main()` with the following:

    ```
    print('Got global: ${pointer_plugin.getGlobal()}');
    final Pointer<Int> globals = pointer_plugin.getGlobals();
    print('Globals: ${globals[0]}');
    print('Globals: ${globals[1]}');
    print('Globals: ${globals[2]}');
   ```

1. Run main with breakpoints. It accesses globalFoo correctly, but once main gets to the line trying to access globals[0], execution will halt before even running the line. On VSCode, a warning pops up with `resume: (-32000) Bad state: The client closed with pending request "resume".`

### Expected results

main.dart should be able to access `globals` from C without crashing

### Actual results

main.dart crashes when accessing the data pointed to by `globals`

### Code sample

<details open><summary>Code sample</summary>

Since this example includes a lot of code, I omitted comments and functions created by the ffigen template (namely `sum` and `sum_long_running`)

/pointer_plugin/pubspec.yaml and /pointer_plugin/src/pointer_plugin.c are unmodified from ffigen template

/lib/main.dart
```dart
import 'dart:ffi';
import 'package:pointer_plugin/pointer_plugin.dart' as pointer_plugin;

void main() {
  print('Got global: ${pointer_plugin.getGlobal()}');
  final Pointer<Int> globals = pointer_plugin.getGlobals();
  print('Globals: ${globals[0]}');
  print('Globals: ${globals[1]}');
  print('Globals: ${globals[2]}');
}
```

/pubspec.yaml
```yaml
name: test_project
description: "A new Flutter project."

publish_to: 'none'

version: 1.0.0+1

environment:
  sdk: ^3.6.0

dependencies:
  flutter:
    sdk: flutter
  cupertino_icons: ^1.0.8
  pointer_plugin:
    path: pointer_plugin

dev_dependencies:
  flutter_test:
    sdk: flutter
  flutter_lints: ^5.0.0

flutter:
  uses-material-design: true
```

/pointer_plugin/ffigen.yaml
```yaml
name: PointerPluginBindings
description: |
  Bindings for `src/pointer_plugin.h`.

  Regenerate bindings with `dart run ffigen --config ffigen.yaml`.
output: 'lib/pointer_plugin_bindings_generated.dart'
headers:
  entry-points:
    - 'src/pointer_plugin.h'
    - 'src/globals.c'
  include-directives:
    - 'src/pointer_plugin.h'
preamble: |
  // ignore_for_file: always_specify_types
  // ignore_for_file: camel_case_types
  // ignore_for_file: non_constant_identifier_names
comments:
  style: any
  length: full
```

/pointer_plugin/src/pointer_plugin.c
```c
#if _WIN32
#define FFI_PLUGIN_EXPORT __declspec(dllexport)
#else
#define FFI_PLUGIN_EXPORT
#endif

FFI_PLUGIN_EXPORT extern int globalFoo;
FFI_PLUGIN_EXPORT extern int globals[];
```

/pointer_plugin/src/globals.h
```c
#include "pointer_plugin.h"
FFI_PLUGIN_EXPORT int globalFoo = 42;
FFI_PLUGIN_EXPORT int globals[] = {3, 2, 1};
```

/pointer_plugin/src/CMakeLists.txt
```cmake
cmake_minimum_required(VERSION 3.10)

project(pointer_plugin_library VERSION 0.0.1 LANGUAGES C)

add_library(pointer_plugin SHARED
  "pointer_plugin.c"
  "globals.c"
)

set_target_properties(pointer_plugin PROPERTIES
  PUBLIC_HEADER pointer_plugin.h
  OUTPUT_NAME "pointer_plugin"
)

target_compile_definitions(pointer_plugin PUBLIC DART_SHARED_LIB)

if (ANDROID)
  # Support Android 15 16k page size
  target_link_options(pointer_plugin PRIVATE "-Wl,-z,max-page-size=16384")
endif()
```

/pointer_plugin/lib/pointer_plugin_bindings_generated.dart
```dart
import 'dart:ffi' as ffi;

/// Bindings for `src/pointer_plugin.h`.
///
/// Regenerate bindings with `dart run ffigen --config ffigen.yaml`.
///
class PointerPluginBindings {
  /// Holds the symbol lookup function.
  final ffi.Pointer<T> Function<T extends ffi.NativeType>(String symbolName)
      _lookup;

  /// The symbols are looked up in [dynamicLibrary].
  PointerPluginBindings(ffi.DynamicLibrary dynamicLibrary)
      : _lookup = dynamicLibrary.lookup;

  /// The symbols are looked up with [lookup].
  PointerPluginBindings.fromLookup(
      ffi.Pointer<T> Function<T extends ffi.NativeType>(String symbolName)
          lookup)
      : _lookup = lookup;

  late final ffi.Pointer<ffi.Int> _globalFoo = _lookup<ffi.Int>('globalFoo');

  int get globalFoo => _globalFoo.value;

  set globalFoo(int value) => _globalFoo.value = value;

  late final ffi.Pointer<ffi.Pointer<ffi.Int>> _globals =
      _lookup<ffi.Pointer<ffi.Int>>('globals');

  ffi.Pointer<ffi.Int> get globals => _globals.value;

  set globals(ffi.Pointer<ffi.Int> value) => _globals.value = value;
}
```

/pointer_plugin/lib/pointer_plugin.dart
```dart
import 'dart:ffi';
import 'dart:io';

import 'pointer_plugin_bindings_generated.dart';

int getGlobal() => _bindings.globalFoo;
Pointer<Int> getGlobals() => _bindings.globals;

const String _libName = 'pointer_plugin';

/// The dynamic library in which the symbols for [PointerPluginBindings] can be found.
final DynamicLibrary _dylib = () {
  if (Platform.isMacOS || Platform.isIOS) {
    return DynamicLibrary.open('$_libName.framework/$_libName');
  }
  if (Platform.isAndroid || Platform.isLinux) {
    return DynamicLibrary.open('lib$_libName.so');
  }
  if (Platform.isWindows) {
    return DynamicLibrary.open('$_libName.dll');
  }
  throw UnsupportedError('Unknown platform: ${Platform.operatingSystem}');
}();

/// The bindings to the native functions in [_dylib].
final PointerPluginBindings _bindings = PointerPluginBindings(_dylib);
```

author: kentnguyen99

title: [Impeller] disable older xclipse gpu driver.
body:
Fixes https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/161334

The first version of the Xclipse series GPU has reported bugs, unfortunately all versions of this GPU report the same driver version. Instead we use the Vulkan version as a proxy, assuming that any newer devices would not lower the supported Vulkan API level.

https://vulkan.gpuinfo.org/listreports.php?devicename=samsung+SM-S906B&platform=android
author: jonahwilliams

author: a-siva

title: Cannot debug in vscode, No Device. flutter run works, flutter devices works
body:
### Steps to reproduce

Not sure how to reproduce this was not an issue for months of development. 

### Actual results

I am trying to build and debug a desktop application on Windows 
```
Major  Minor  Build  Revision
-----  -----  -----  --------
10     0      22631  0
```

I can build and run the application.
flutter run:
```
Connected devices:
Windows (desktop) • windows • windows-x64    • Microsoft Windows [Version 10.0.22631.4751]
Chrome (web)      • chrome  • web-javascript • Google Chrome 131.0.6778.265
Edge (web)        • edge    • web-javascript • Microsoft Edge 132.0.2957.115
[1]: Windows (windows)
[2]: Chrome (chrome)
[3]: Edge (edge)
Please choose one (or "q" to quit): 1
Launching lib\main.dart on Windows in debug mode...
Building Windows application...                                    15.8s
√ Built build\windows\x64\runner\Debug\foo.exe
Syncing files to device Windows...                                  53ms

Flutter run key commands.
r Hot reload.
R Hot restart.
h List all available interactive commands.
d Detach (terminate "flutter run" but leave application running).
c Clear the screen
q Quit (terminate the application on the device).

A Dart VM Service on Windows is available at: http://127.0.0.1:53151/dkEe3j_ZBhw=/
The Flutter DevTools debugger and profiler on Windows is available at: http://127.0.0.1:9102?uri=http://127.0.0.1:53151/dkEe3j_ZBhw=/
```
flutter devices
```
Found 3 connected devices:
  Windows (desktop) • windows • windows-x64    • Microsoft Windows [Version 10.0.22631.4751]
  Chrome (web)      • chrome  • web-javascript • Google Chrome 131.0.6778.265
  Edge (web)        • edge    • web-javascript • Microsoft Edge 132.0.2957.115

Run "flutter emulators" to list and start any available device emulators.

If you expected another device to be detected, please run "flutter doctor" to diagnose potential issues. You may also try increasing the time to wait for connected devices with the    
"--device-timeout" flag. Visit https://flutter.dev/setup/ for troubleshooting tips.
```

However **I cannot debug using VSCODE**. 
When I try to debug
```
Select a device to use
```
pops up but there are no options. 

Bottom right corner of VSCODE I see 
```
Plain Text | Cursor Tab | No Device 
```

It seems tha VSCode does not understand that windows device is working. 

I tried a full re-install of VSCode including removing all %appdata% and %userdata% folders 
as well as a full re-install of flutter SDK. 

Any suggestions are welcome. 




### Logs

<summary>Logs</summary>

title: Exception caught by rendering library fluent_ui
body:
### Steps to reproduce

Implemented list of chat sessions with library fluent_ui

### Expected results

Implemented list of chat sessions

### Actual results

Error rendering application

### Code sample

<details open><summary>Code sample</summary>

```dart
PaneItemWidgetAdapter(
                child: ListView.builder(
                  controller: _scrollController,
                  itemCount: state.chat.sessions.length,
                  itemBuilder: (BuildContext context, int index) {
                    final ChatSession session = state.chat.sessions[index];
                    _isSelected = session.id == state.chat.currentSessionId;

                    return Expanded(
                      child: Text(
                        session.messages.firstOrNull?.content ?? 'No messages',
                        overflow: TextOverflow.ellipsis,
                        textAlign: TextAlign.center,
                        style: const TextStyle(
                          fontSize: 14,
                          fontWeight: FontWeight.w500,
                        ),
                      ),
                    );
                  },
                ),
              ),
```

Where [flutter-3.29-candidate.0](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/tree/flutter-3.29-candidate.0) is the beta candidate branch and 010c8a806bccad64ab9972286b85dd24ca98441f is the latest commit on that branch.

title: Add FGP Gradle wrapper to source control
body:
Adds the `gradlew`, `gradlew.bat`, and `gradle/wrapper/gradle-wrapper.properties` within `packages/flutter_tools/gradle` to source control.

These files are not binaries, so it doesn't run afoul of this policy
https://github.com/flutter/flutter/blob/bd1ebf2e1498bd022808f8b237654ce42ae537be/dev/bots/analyze.dart#L1695-L1700

And it is the recommendation of Gradle, per https://docs.gradle.org/current/dsl/org.gradle.api.tasks.wrapper.Wrapper.html.

Also gitignores a `local.properties` file, which is output when opening Android Studio in the FGP root, and the gradle jar, which is a binary.

## Pre-launch Checklist

- [ ] I read the [Contributor Guide] and followed the process outlined there for submitting PRs.
- [ ] I read the [Tree Hygiene] wiki page, which explains my responsibilities.
- [ ] I read and followed the [Flutter Style Guide], including [Features we expect every widget to implement].
- [ ] I signed the [CLA].

- [ ] I updated/added relevant documentation (doc comments with `///`).
- [ ] I added new tests to check the change I am making, or this PR is [test-exempt].
- [ ] I followed the [breaking change policy] and added [Data Driven Fixes] where supported.
- [ ] All existing and new tests are passing.

If you need help, consider asking for advice on the #hackers-new channel on [Discord].

title: video player keeps loading and does't play a video form a secured storage
body:
i was working on a project that will play a downloaded youtube video from secured storage and at first i can hear the audio but video was not working on some specific devices like android 10 11 and 12 devices. but then i disabled Impeller and it worked with full video and audio support.


but still some devices are having challange playing the video like, it keeps loading or the buffer keeps circling but no video starting to play. if there is any solution i would like to hear it from guys and thank you.
author: eyuelfrew

title: video player keeps loading and does't play a video form a secured storage
body:
i was working on a project that will play a downloaded youtube video from secured storage and at first i can hear the audio but video was not working on some specific devices like android 10 11 and 12 devices.  but then i disabled Impeller and it worked with full video and audio support.

  <meta-data
            android:name="io.flutter.embedding.android.EnableImpeller"
            android:value="false" />
but still some devices are having challange playing the video like, it keeps loading or the buffer keeps circling but no video starting to play. if there is any solution i would like to hear it from guys and thank you.

author: Lukas2019

title: I keep making the mistake of typing`flutter add package_name` instead of `flutter pub add package_name`
body:
### Use case

I keep making the mistake of typing`flutter add package_name` instead of `flutter pub add package_name`
can we make these two functions equivalent or make some kind of alias somewhere?

### Proposal

up
author: stephane-archer

### Steps to reproduce

1. Run the attached code sample on iOS

### Expected results

The polyline uses rounded caps and joints as specified in the code.

Here's how it looks like on Android:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e9028700-1b5d-483a-9900-61ffc5a0012a)

Here's the same thing on the Web:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c24f7ca4-76f5-4d1b-8596-9d92488d8249)

### Actual results

The polyline ignores the startCap, endCap and joint settings:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7fb48539-be91-49fe-ad1c-44f8577d4ee8)

### Code sample

<details open><summary>Code sample</summary>

```dart
import 'package:flutter/material.dart';
import 'package:google_maps_flutter/google_maps_flutter.dart';

class PolylinesSample extends StatelessWidget {
  const PolylinesSample({super.key});

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return GoogleMap(
      initialCameraPosition: CameraPosition(target: LatLng(49, -23)),
      polylines: {
        Polyline(
          polylineId: PolylineId('titanic route'),
          points: [
            LatLng(50.90, -1.41), // Southampton
            LatLng(49.65, -1.60), // Cherbourg
            LatLng(49.77, -6.71),
            LatLng(51.83, -8.28), // Cobh
            LatLng(50.96, -8.58),
            LatLng(41.75, -49.90), // Wreck
          ],
          startCap: Cap.roundCap,
          endCap: Cap.roundCap,
          jointType: JointType.round,
          width: 5,
          color: Colors.red,
          geodesic: true,
        ),
      },
    );
  }
}

```

</details>

### Steps to reproduce

1. Run the attached code sample in Chrome

### Expected results

Icon is yellow because of `BitmapDescriptor.defaultMarkerWithHue(BitmapDescriptor.hueYellow)`.

This is how it looks like on Android:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b289db4b-826f-4e85-97dc-840bfa451727)

### Actual results

Icon is red. 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/2129ea11-f5d2-481c-b2cd-f5f60e252ded)

Also note the deprecation warning in the logs.

### Code sample

<details open><summary>Code sample</summary>

```dart
import 'package:flutter/material.dart';
import 'package:google_maps_flutter/google_maps_flutter.dart';

/// Shows advanced options of markers.
class MarkerCustomIconSample extends StatelessWidget {
  const MarkerCustomIconSample({super.key});

  @override
  State<MarkerCustomIconSample> createState() => _MarkerCustomIconSampleState();
}

class _MarkerCustomIconSampleState extends State<MarkerCustomIconSample> {
  late Marker _marker = Marker(
    markerId: MarkerId('my_marker'),
    icon: BitmapDescriptor.defaultMarkerWithHue(BitmapDescriptor.hueYellow),
  );

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return GoogleMap(
      initialCameraPosition: CameraPosition(target: LatLng(0, 0)),
      markers: {_marker},
    );
  }
}

```

</details>


### Screenshots or Videos

<details open>
<summary>Screenshots / Video demonstration</summary>

See above.

</details>

```console

Debug service listening on ws://127.0.0.1:60541/LI2fCijxbYE=/ws
As of February 21st, 2024, google.maps.Marker is deprecated. Please use google.maps.marker.AdvancedMarkerElement instead. At this time, google.maps.Marker is not scheduled to be discontinued, but google.maps.marker.AdvancedMarkerElement is recommended over google.maps.Marker. While google.maps.Marker will continue to receive bug fixes for any major regressions, existing bugs in google.maps.Marker will not be addressed. At least 12 months notice will be given before support is discontinued. Please see https://developers.google.com/maps/deprecations for additional details and https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/advanced-markers/migration for the migration guide.

```

author: AngeloFriello

title: Swift "Executing channel handlers on background threads" example doesn't work
body:
### Steps to reproduce

1. create plugin with command: `flutter create --org com.example_test_background_thread --template=plugin --platforms=ios -i swift background_plugin`
2. Add to `ios/Classes/BackgroundPlugin.swift` within `register` method `let taskQueue = registrar.messenger.makeBackgroundTaskQueue()` like mentioned in [example](https://docs.flutter.dev/platform-integration/platform-channels#executing-channel-handlers-on-background-threads:~:text=content_copy-,In%20Swift%3A,-info)
3. Get `Method 'messenger' was used as a property; add () to call it`.
4. Get `Function produces expected type 'FlutterStandardMethodCodec'; did you mean to call it with '()'?`
4. Change to `let taskQueue = registrar.messenger().makeBackgroundTaskQueue()` and to `FlutterStandardMethodCodec.sharedInstance()`
5. Get `Value of optional type '(() -> any FlutterTaskQueue)?' must be unwrapped to a value of type '() -> any FlutterTaskQueue'` error
6. Change to `let taskQueue = registrar.messenger().makeBackgroundTaskQueue?()`
7. Success. Which is not what example provides.

### Expected results

Code provided from [example](https://docs.flutter.dev/platform-integration/platform-channels#executing-channel-handlers-on-background-threads:~:text=content_copy-,In%20Swift%3A,-info) works "as is" without modifying 

### Actual results

Getting errors.

### Code sample

<details open><summary>Code sample</summary>

```swift
import Flutter
import UIKit

public class BackgroundPlugin: NSObject, FlutterPlugin {
    public static func register(with registrar: FlutterPluginRegistrar) {
        let taskQueue = registrar.messenger.makeBackgroundTaskQueue()
        let channel = FlutterMethodChannel(name: "background_plugin",
                                           binaryMessenger: registrar.messenger(),
                                           codec: FlutterStandardMethodCodec.sharedInstance,
                                           taskQueue: taskQueue)
        let instance = BackgroundPlugin()
        registrar.addMethodCallDelegate(instance, channel: channel)

    }

    public func handle(_ call: FlutterMethodCall, result: @escaping FlutterResult) {
        switch call.method {
        case "getPlatformVersion":
            result("iOS" + UIDevice.current.systemVersion)
        default:
            result(FlutterMethodNotImplemented)
        }
    }
}

```

</details>

title: Error: Framework 'Flutter' Not Found in Xcode Build
body: I'm facing an issue while building my Flutter app for the iOS simulator. The build fails with the error: vbnet Copy Edit Error (Xcode): Framework 'Flutter' not found Error (Xcode): Linker command failed with exit code 1 I've tried the following steps: Recreated the ios/ folder and cleared derived data. Ran flutter clean, reinstalled CocoaPods (pod deintegrate and pod install). Verified AppDelegate and framework paths in Xcode. Ensured the deployment target is set to 14.0 in the Podfile. Despite these efforts, the issue persists. I'm using the latest Flutter SDK, Xcode, and macOS versions. Any guidance to resolve this would be greatly appreciated AppDelegateSwift ```swift import Flutter import UIKit @main @objc class AppDelegate: FlutterAppDelegate { override func application( _ application: UIApplication, didFinishLaunchingWithOptions launchOptions: [UIApplication.LaunchOptionsKey: Any]? ) -> Bool { GeneratedPluginRegistrant.register(with: self) return super.application(application, didFinishLaunchingWithOptions: launchOptions) } } ``` and my podfile ``` platform :ios, '14.0' # CocoaPods analytics sends network stats synchronously affecting flutter build latency. ENV['COCOAPODS_DISABLE_STATS'] = 'true' project 'Runner', { 'Debug' => :debug, 'Profile' => :release, 'Release' => :release, } def flutter_root generated_xcode_build_settings_path = File.expand_path(File.join('..', 'Flutter', 'Generated.xcconfig'), __FILE__) unless File.exist?(generated_xcode_build_settings_path) raise "#{generated_xcode_build_settings_path} must exist. If you're running pod install manually, make sure flutter pub get is executed first" end File.foreach(generated_xcode_build_settings_path) do |line| matches = line.match(/FLUTTER_ROOT\=(.*)/) return matches[1].strip if matches end raise "FLUTTER_ROOT not found in #{generated_xcode_build_settings_path}. Try deleting Generated.xcconfig, then run flutter pub get" end require File.expand_path(File.join('packages', 'flutter_tools', 'bin', 'podhelper'), flutter_root) flutter_ios_podfile_setup target 'Runner' do use_frameworks! use_modular_headers! flutter_install_all_ios_pods File.dirname(File.realpath(__FILE__)) target 'RunnerTests' do inherit! :search_paths end end post_install do |installer| installer.pods_project.targets.each do |target| flutter_additional_ios_build_settings(target) target.build_configurations.each do |config| xcconfig_path = config.base_configuration_reference.real_path xcconfig = File.read(xcconfig_path) xcconfig_mod = xcconfig.gsub(/DT_TOOLCHAIN_DIR/, "TOOLCHAIN_DIR") end end end ``` and the issue while running Flutter Run --verbose this is the in-depth error outcome: ```console [ +56 ms] Failed to build iOS app [ +2 ms] Error (Xcode): Framework 'Flutter' not found [ +3 ms] Error (Xcode): Linker command failed with exit code 1 (use -v to see invocation) [ +2 ms] Could not build the application for the simulator. [ ] Error launching application on iPhone 16 Pro Max. [ +4 ms] "flutter run" took 99,035ms. [ +30 ms] #0 throwToolExit (package:flutter_tools/src/base/common.dart:10:3) #1 RunCommand.runCommand (package:flutter_tools/src/commands/run.dart:860:9) #2 FlutterCommand.run. (package:flutter_tools/src/runner/flutter_command.dart:1450:27) #3 AppContext.run. (package:flutter_tools/src/base/context.dart:153:19) #4 CommandRunner.runCommand (package:args/command_runner.dart:212:13) #5 FlutterCommandRunner.runCommand. (package:flutter_tools/src/runner/flutter_command_runner.dart:421:9) #6 AppContext.run. (package:flutter_tools/src/base/context.dart:153:19) #7 FlutterCommandRunner.runCommand (package:flutter_tools/src/runner/flutter_command_runner.dart:364:5) #8 run.. (package:flutter_tools/runner.dart:131:9) #9 AppContext.run. (package:flutter_tools/src/base/context.dart:153:19) #10 main (package:flutter_tools/executable.dart:94:3) I've attempted the following solutions to resolve the issue: ``` Performed flutter clean, removed and reinstalled Pods (pod deintegrate, pod install). Deleted derived data using rm -rf ~/Library/Developer/Xcode/DerivedData. Recreated the ios/ folder. Updated CocoaPods and ensured all dependencies in pubspec.yaml are up-to-date. Verified AppDelegate.swift and ensured Firebase setup (added FirebaseCore initialization in AppDelegate.swift). Despite these efforts, the issue persists. Initially, I managed to resolve it by running these steps in sequence: bash Copy Edit flutter clean rm -rf ios/Pods rm -rf ios/.symlinks rm -rf ios/Flutter/Flutter.framework sudo gem install cocoapods pod repo update cd ios pod install flutter upgrade flutter pub get cd ios pod deintegrate pod install rm -rf ~/Library/Developer/Xcode/DerivedData flutter clean flutter pub get cd ios pod install cd .. flutter run This fixed the issue temporarily. However, after two days, I faced errors in Firebase phone authentication. I added FirebaseCore initialization in AppDelegate.swift, which resolved the Firebase error but reintroduced the "Framework 'Flutter' not found" error. I’m seeking guidance to resolve this persistent issue once and for all. Any insights or suggestions would be greatly appreciated! . #bug, enhancement, #help wanted, #priority #160091 #FlutterFramework not found

title: Can MaterialApp downgrade call another MaterialApp?
body:
Can MaterialApp downgrade call another MaterialApp?

I want to explore. application can be split into multiple independent modules (microservices), where each module is a separate `MaterialApp`, and they do not interfere with each other. author: wajipu

title: Add form level data input validation
body:
### Use case

Validating form data input across multiple form fields is not supported.  For example, comparing 'start' and 'finish' data form fields to ensure that start is before or equal to finish. 

A work around is possible by using global keys at a field level, but this becomes increasingly complex to manage over multiple fields. 


### Proposal

Add an 'onValidate' function attribute at the form widget level that would be called after all field level validations have passed.

title: `ElevatedButtonThemeData.textStyle` & `FilledButtonThemeData.textStyle` are not being applied to child text descendants
body:
### Steps to reproduce 1. Create an empty app with minimal scaffolding setup and a button 2. Define button theme data including text style 3. Run the app ### Expected results `FilledButton` Text should appear in right color ### Actual results `FilledButton` child `Text()` widget color won't change ### Code sample
Code sample ```dart import 'package:flutter/material.dart'; void main() => runApp(Foo()); class Foo extends StatelessWidget { const Foo({super.key}); @override Widget build(BuildContext context) => MaterialApp( theme: ThemeData( filledButtonTheme: FilledButtonThemeData( style: ButtonStyle( textStyle: WidgetStatePropertyAll( TextStyle( color: Colors.amber, ), ), ), ), ), home: Scaffold( body: SafeArea( child: Column( children: [ Text('Sample App'), FilledButton(onPressed: () {}, child: Text('Test Button')), ], ), ), ), ); } ```
